definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: But, despite huge upheavals in the world, little has altered.
sentences.chinese: 縱觀國際社會亂象紛生，聯合國卻幾乎一成不變。

sentences.english: Her hair is dry and messy like a bunch of straw.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮又幹又亂象一束禾稈草。

sentences.english: Minister hits at 'vulgarity' in culture sector.
sentences.chinese: 文化部部長蔡武抨擊庸俗文化亂象。

sentences.english: The chaos of China's financial calling the rule of law and constitutional government.
sentences.chinese: 亂象叢生的中國財政呼喚着法治與憲政。

sentences.english: It is easy to cancel the penalty target, but the difficult thing is to overhaul the fine chaos.
sentences.chinese: 取消罰款指標並不難，難的是如何根治罰款亂象。

definition: to suppress/to crack down on/to prohibit
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
